data.sampled:
Fe+O2=Fe3O4
This chemical reaction is a single replacement reaction (also known as a 1:1 replacement) because both the reactants and products (Fe+O2 and Fe3O4) are the same. To balance this chemical equation, you can make either reactants or products into the parent binomials. For example, if you add 2Fe3O4 to Fe+O2, you'll get: Fe+O2=Fe3O4 or Fe+O2⇒Fe-Fe3O4. Then, you can balance Fe with Fe3O4 by adding -Fe to key the equation: Fe-Fe3O4 = Fe+O2.

data.sampled:
"You've got it right. Copper (Cu) reacts with water (H2O) to form copper hydroxide (Cu(OH)2) and releases hydrogen (H2) gas. Wood reacts with carbon dioxide (CO2) and releases oxygen gas (O2) as a byproduct. So CO2 + H2O = O2. Is there anything else I can assist you with?";

(a) Yes, can you explain how the chemical reaction takes place?
(b) How do the reactants react? (explain the chemical equation)
(c) Can you give an example of a chemical reaction that uses two reactants that release gases?
You are correct. When copper reacts with water to form copper hydroxide, it gives out a lot of oxygen gas and forms a semi-soluble copper trisodium sulfate compound. Copper also released hydrogen gas when it reacts with water. When you react stick wood with water, wood will turn brown and release oxygen gas while also leading to carbon dioxide gas. The chemical reaction takes place between CO2 and H2O, and when CO2 reacts with water, it releases O2 and forms a white foam with a distinct leavening powder effect. The reaction makes it possible for the dough to rise properly when baking due to the formation of bubbles that cause the dough to expand.

In the first equation, you have "CO + O2 = OCO" while in the second equation you have "CO + O2 = CO2". This is due to the fact that CO2 is a compound with two hydrogen atoms and one carbon atom, whereas in the first equation CO is a compound with two carbon atoms and two oxygen atoms. So for this equation, we start by adding 10 H2O to give us FE10 + H2O = FE10 + 10 H2O = 10 + 10 = 105 H2O and ignoring \text{the methylation on the H and O atoms}. Then we can continue the same process, adding 10 H2O to FE10 + 10 H2O = 10 FE10 + 10 FE10, which gives us FE10 + FE10 = 10 FE10 + 10 FE10, so FE10 + FE10 = 10 FE10.
